alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 14 at 6:31PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Windy Through Wednesday.. ...Cold Temperatures Through Friday Morning... Northeast winds of 10 to 20 mph will continue through Wednesday and cause drifting snow across many roads. Over Summits such as Cleary Summit and the White Mountains winds are gusting to 30 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. Wind chills of 15 to 30 below will continue through Wednesday. Valleys across the Interior will have low temperatures of 10 to 30 below through Friday, while hills will have lows of zero to 15 below. Low temperatures will be less extreme tonight in windy areas, but the wind chills will still be near 30 below. Highs of zero to 10 above are expected Wednesday and Thursday in hills and valleys. Highs will rise into the teens on Friday, with temperatures warming above normal this weekend and remaining warm into next week. People outside through Wednesday should be prepared for cold wind chills and drifting snow.
